Write a summary about 'prehistory'. Limit the output to 150 words. What are the time periods that prehistory is divided into? How are prehistorians able to study prehistory?
Prehistory refers to the period of human history before written records exist. It is divided into three time periods: the Paleolithic (Stone Age), Mesolithic (Middle Stone Age), and Neolithic (New Stone Age) eras. During the Paleolithic era, early humans developed tools and learned to control fire. The Mesolithic era saw the emergence of more complex societies, while the Neolithic era introduced agriculture and settled communities. Prehistorians study prehistory through archaeological evidence, such as artifacts, fossils, and geological deposits. They also use scientific techniques, such as radiocarbon dating, to determine the age of these findings. Additionally, prehistorians rely on oral traditions and written records from ancient civilizations to supplement their research. By analyzing these sources, prehistorians can reconstruct the lives of early humans and understand the development of human societies. The study of prehistory helps us learn about our shared human history.  ​

Write a summary about 'prehistory'. Limit the output to 150 words. The term 'prehistory' refers to the period of time before written records existed. The study of prehistory provides a unique perspective on human evolution and the development of complex societies. The study of prehistory is essential to understanding the origins of modern societies and the evolution of human societies over time. The story of human beings before written records is called prehistory. It is the time when humans first appeared in Africa and developed their own ways of life. People used tools, spoke languages, and made their own rules. They also learned to grow their own food and take care of animals. Experts called archaeologists and anthropologists study prehistory. They dig up old places, look at things people left behind, and compare how different people lived. By studying prehistory, we can learn how humans changed and grew over time. This helps us understand how modern societies were created. We can also see how different people lived and what they believed in. Prehistory is a very important subject to learn about our past.

Prehistory is the period of time before written records existed, spanning from the emergence of the first humans to the invention of writing. During this time, humans developed from a few scattered groups to complex societies, and their cultures, technologies, and ways of life evolved significantly. The prehistoric period can be divided into several sub-periods, including the Paleolithic, Mesolithic, and Neolithic, each characterized by distinct tools, subsistence strategies, and social organizations. Archaeologists and anthropologists study the material remains of prehistoric cultures, such as tools, art, and architecture, to reconstruct their lives and societies. This knowledge provides insights into the development of human societies, the evolution of technologies, and the impact of environmental factors on human history. By studying prehistory, we can better understand the origins of modern human societies and the complex relationships between humans and their environments. A long time ago, before people could write, there was a time called prehistory. This time is hard to study because there aren't any written records. We can still learn about it by finding old things and looking at how people lived. Prehistory is divided into three parts: the Old Stone Age, the Middle Stone Age, and the New Stone Age. In the Old Stone Age, people made tools from rocks, wood, and bones. As time went on, people made better tools and started growing food. In the New Stone Age, people grew a lot of food and had bigger communities. Scientists and explorers have figured out what life was like during prehistory by finding old things and studying them.
